summary: This bill, the Foreign Animal Disease Prevention, Surveillance, and Rapid Response Act of 2025, amends the Animal Health Protection Act to reauthorize animal disease prevention and management programs. It outlines mandatory funding from the Commodity Credit Corporation for fiscal years 2023-2029 and beyond, allocating specific amounts for different subsections of the program. The bill also amends sections of the Act related to the National animal health laboratory network and the national animal disease preparedness and response program, including updating authorization of appropriations for these initiatives.
